metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5025 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in data_sources.php in Cacti 0.8.8b allows remote authenticated users with console access to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the name_cache parameter in a ds_edit action.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-7').
